headline: Rate cuts would be boon for 2026 retail spending: Goldman Sachs
summary: Goldman Sachs will hear from top executives and retail leaders at its 32nd Annual Global Retailing Conference later this week. Goldman Sachs US retail analyst in global investment research Kate McShane shares her 2026 forecast for US consumer spending with Josh Lipton and what interest rate cuts could mean for lower and middle-income Americans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Walmart and Sam's Club's Children's Miracle Network Campaign Concludes, Raising Over $43 Million for Children's Miracle Network Hospitals
summary: Walmart and Sam′s Club concluded their annual Children's Miracle Network campaign, held from June 9 to July 6. During this four−week initiative, customers, members, and associates rallied nationwide, raising more than $43 million for Children's Miracle Network Hospitals (CMN Hospitals). These vital funds directly support local children's hospitals across the U.S. and Canada, providing essential care to millions of children in their communities.

headline: RetailMeNot Launches App-Exclusive "5 to Buy" Savings Event: Weekly Cash Back on September's Top Five Shopping Categories
summary: Today, RetailMeNot, a leading savings and cash back destination, announces the launch of its "5 to Buy" September savings event - available only in the RetailMeNot app. Beginning Tuesday, September 2, and continuing every Tuesday of the month, shoppers can unlock one-day-only cash back exclusives of up to 30% across five of September's most in-demand shopping categories.

headline: Exclusive-Amazon US Prime sign-ups slow despite expanded promotion, data shows
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Amazon doubled its Prime Day discount sales to four days this year and touted blowout numbers days after the event.  Sign-ups in the U.S. failed to meet last year's total and even the company's own target, according to internal company data reviewed by Reuters.  The world's largest online retailer registered 5.4 million U.S. sign-ups over the 21-day run-up to Prime Day and its four-day sales event from July 8 to July 11.

The world's largest online retailer registered 5.4 million U.S. sign-ups over the 21-day run-up to Prime Day and its four-day sales event from July 8 to July 11.
